website_summaries.verdict: Its wide array of ports and desktop-saving small footprint are great, but it is a must-have for anyone with a pair of quality 4K displays.
pros: Connects a pair of 4K displays at once
Innovative shape works as a laptop stand

customer_reviews.title: Great until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: This thing was absolutely amazing while it worked. I had two extra monitors hooked up to my laptop and was wizzing away and being all productive and stuff. ... and then it stopped working. =( About 2 months after I started using it, the displays would no longer register. I could still power my laptop through the USB-C, but NO other functionality worked. No displays, no headphone jack, no extra USB-C slot. I LOVED this thing while it was working. But I don't think it's realistic to buy it every two months =(

I need to charge my work laptop independently from the hub. Also the setup was kind of difficult because the Targus website was hard to navigate and find the drivers needed for dual monitor support. Nothing someone who is comfortable with computers wouldn’t be able to do, but still irksome.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chromebooks, hold off on Mac
customer_reviews.text: I was originally using for both my Macbook and Pixelbook. Unfortunately with the latest MacOS update, Apple broken the driver (likely on purpose because it doesn't use Thunderbolt - their proprietary protocol that requires a license). I don't blame the dock for this as they don't advertise it as a Thunderbolt dock. That said, they have a working beta driver to enable one monitor and sounds like they are working to restore dual monitor functionality. Still works perfectly for my Pixelbook with gigabit ethernet, mouse, keyboard and dual monitors over DisplayPort with just a single USB-C.

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Targus USB-C quad dock (DOCK570USZ). What I received was DOCK520USZ. The shipped model only offers HDMI. I specifically chose the DOCK570USZ because it has four display ports. Additionally, a non-Targus power supply was sent with this unit. The product description indicated that the power supply was to provide 100W. The shipped power supply was rated for 65W. The rather stark departure from what was described to what was shipped creates an opinion in my that this was either (1) utter neglect, or (2) intentional. Buyer beware.

product_meta.title: Targus USB-C Universal Dual Video 4K Laptop Docking Station with Charging Power, Audio, & 4 USB Ports for PC, Mac, & Android (DOCK180USZ), black
product_meta.description: This dock combines performance plus power, with the ability to plug in two 4K monitors and power your laptop while saving space on your desk. Get the most of your workstation with two ultra-high-def monitors. Plug them in with the USB-C Universal DV4K Docking Station with Power, which is Thunderbolt 3 compatible and supports both DisplayPort and HDMI. It’ll help keep your laptop, and your productivity, humming all day long as it delivers integrated power and charging for most USB-C laptops up to 60W. With four USB 3.0 ports (including one that’s high-powered for charging devices), plus an Audio In/Out port for speakers, mics, or earphones, it’s easy to customize your workstation. Best yet, the dock will help save real estate on your desk, with a wedge design meant to prop up your laptop. This dock combines power with productivity in a compact size
feature_bullets: 1 USB-C device port (USB 3.0 data only). 4 USB 3.0 ports for the latest peripherals (1 fast device-charging port)
1 Gigabit Ethernet port for secure, wire speed Ethernet access. Power Delivery 2.0 provides up to 60W charging
2 DisplayPort (DP 1.2a) and 2 HDMI (HDMI 2.0) ports support dual 4K Ultra HD monitors. 1 3.5mm combo Audio In/Out for mics, speakers, and earphones
Includes 1-meter USB-C to C host cable (detachable). Thunderbolt 3 compatible
Ergonomic wedge design for comfortable typing. Integrated lock slot accommodates industry-standard security locks
